title: refactor(socket-async): extract common validation logic to reduce duplication
body:
## Summary
The `socket_async_submit` and `socket_async_submit_with_timeout` functions contain duplicated parameter validation logic (~30 lines of identical code).

## Location
- File: `/home/tetsuo/git/tetsuo-socket/src/socket/SocketAsync.c`
- Lines: 818-863 (socket_async_submit) and 1432-1482 (socket_async_submit_with_timeout)

## Issue
Both functions validate:
- `!async || !socket || !cb || len == 0`
- `type == REQ_SEND && !send_buf`
- `type == REQ_RECV && !recv_buf`
- Socket nonblocking setup with TRY/EXCEPT
- Request setup and submission
- Error handling with identical error messages

This violates DRY principle and increases maintenance burden.

## Recommendation
Extract common validation logic into a static helper function:
```c
static void
validate_async_submit_params(T async, Socket_T socket, enum AsyncRequestType type,
                              const void *send_buf, void *recv_buf, size_t len,
                              SocketAsync_Callback cb)
{
    /* Validation logic here */
}
```

Both functions can then call this helper before proceeding with their specific logic.

## Category
Redundancy

## Severity
HIGH

## Pattern ID
DUPLICATED_VALIDATION
